name: Data Display
description: Manual accessibility checklist for data display components (tables, lists, cards, badges)

items.description: Data table has proper structure with th elements
items.procedure: Verify table uses <th> for headers with scope attribute (col/row)
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces column/row headers when navigating cells

items.description: Complex tables use headers attribute for cell association
items.procedure: For multi-level headers, verify cells use headers attribute to reference relevant th IDs
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader correctly associates data cells with all relevant headers

items.description: Table has accessible caption or aria-label
items.procedure: Verify table has <caption> element or aria-label describing its purpose
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces table purpose before navigating content

items.procedure: Verify unordered lists use <ul><li>, ordered lists use <ol><li>, descriptions use <dl><dt><dd>
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces list type and item count

items.description: Cards have accessible name when interactive
items.procedure: If card is a link/button, verify it has accessible name describing the content
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces card purpose when focused

items.procedure: Verify card headings use proper heading levels (h2, h3, etc.) in page hierarchy
items.expectedOutcome: Heading levels follow logical order without skipping levels

items.procedure: Review headings and labels for descriptiveness and clarity

items.description: Decorative images have empty alt text
items.procedure: Verify purely decorative images have alt=''

items.description: Status badges convey meaning to screen readers
items.procedure: Verify status badges have visually hidden text or aria-label explaining status
items.expectedOutcome: Screen reader announces badge meaning, not just visual appearance

items.description: Status is not conveyed by color alone
items.procedure: Verify status indicators use icons, text, or patterns in addition to color
items.expectedOutcome: Status is perceivable in grayscale/to users with color blindness
